{"id":231656194,"question_id":2,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"5Â years","timestamp":1558937891,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"9 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/231656194/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"45.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * public class ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode next;\n *     ListNode(int x) { val = x; }\n * }\n */\n\nimport  java.lang.System;\n\nclass Solution {\n    public ListNode addTwoNumbers(ListNode l1, ListNode l2) {\n        ListNode dummyHead = new ListNode(0);\n        ListNode p = l1, q = l2, curr = dummyHead;\n        int carry = 0;\n        while (p != null || q != null) {\n            int x = (p != null) ? p.val : 0;\n            int y = (q != null) ? q.val : 0;\n            int sum = carry + x + y;\n            carry = sum / 10;\n            curr.next = new ListNode(sum % 10);\n            curr = curr.next;\n            if (p != null) p = p.next;\n            if (q != null) q = q.next;\n        }\n        if (carry > 0) {\n            curr.next = new ListNode(carry);\n        }\n        System.out.print( dummyHead.next);\n        \n        return dummyHead.next;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
